markdown:
The phoenix is a primordial bird made of heat and flame that dwells in the most inhospitable regions of the desert. Though highly intelligent and brimming with compassion, the phoenix is best-known for its iconic ability to resurrect itself when slain, emerging reborn from the ashes of its own corpse. Phoenixes are often sought out for their knowledge or healing abilities, as they cannot abide the sight of suffering and deny their succor only to the most foul and irredeemable of creatures. Phoenixes enjoy the company of metallic dragons, and when the two dwell in close proximity, they can forge lifelong friendships, sharing their resources and words of wisdom while keeping each other updated on regional news. While most phoenixes are benevolent, they are not infallible. When a phoenix loses its way or falls under the influence of evil, it still retains its strong appetite for knowledge. Evil phoenixes are known to assault universities and libraries in their pursuit for power—not only to gain new information, but also to set fire to the texts and thus hoard that knowledge for themselves. **[Recall Knowledge - Beast](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)** ([Arcana](/Skills.aspx?ID=2), [Nature](/Skills.aspx?ID=10)): DC 39 **[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 37 **[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 34 [Phoenix](/Monsters.aspx?ID=330) **Source** [Bestiary](/Sources.aspx?ID=2) pg. 261 **Perception** +27; darkvision, [_detect magic_](/Spells.aspx?ID=66), [_see invisibility_](/Spells.aspx?ID=271) **Languages** [Auran](/Languages.aspx?ID=15), [Celestial](/Languages.aspx?ID=16), [Common](/Languages.aspx?ID=1), [Ignan](/Languages.aspx?ID=18) **Skills** [Acrobatics](/Skills.aspx?ID=1) +30, [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=3) +27, [Diplomacy](/Skills.aspx?ID=6) +31, [Intimidation](/Skills.aspx?ID=7) +27, [Nature](/Skills.aspx?ID=10) +25 **Str** +6 **Dex** +7 **Con** +5 **Int** +7 **Wis** +6 **Cha** +6 --- **AC** 36 **Fort** +27 **Ref** +31 **Will** +28 +1 status to all saves vs. magic **HP** 300 (self-resurrection) , regeneration 20 (deactivated by [cold](/Traits.aspx?ID=27) or evil) **Immunities** fire **Weaknesses** cold 10, evil 10 **Self-Resurrection** ([healing](/Traits.aspx?ID=89), [necromancy](/Traits.aspx?ID=117), [primal](/Traits.aspx?ID=134)) When a phoenix dies, it collapses into a pile of smoldering ashes before returning to life fully healed 1d4 rounds later, as if subject to a 7th-level [_resurrect_](/Rituals.aspx?ID=20) ritual. Self-resurrection happens only if there are some remains to resurrect; for instance, a phoenix killed by a [_disintegrate_](/Spells.aspx?ID=76) spell can’t use this ability. A phoenix whose remains rest within an area devoted to an evil deity by [_consecrate_](/Rituals.aspx?ID=8) can’t self-resurrect until its remains are no longer in that area. A phoenix can self-resurrect only once per year.
**Shroud of Flame** ([aura](/Traits.aspx?ID=206), [evocation](/Traits.aspx?ID=65), [fire](/Traits.aspx?ID=72), [primal](/Traits.aspx?ID=134)) 20 feet. 4d6 fire, DC 37 basic Reflex save. While this aura is active, any adjacent creature that hits the phoenix with a melee attack or otherwise touches it takes 2d6 fire damage. The phoenix can activate or deactivate the aura with a single action, which has the concentrate trait. --- **Speed** 25 feet, fly 70 feet **Melee** beak +30 ([Finesse](/Traits.aspx?ID=179), [Fire](/Traits.aspx?ID=72), [Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103), [reach 20 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=192)), **Damage** 1d12+9 piercing plus 3d8 fire and 2d10 persistent fire **Melee** talon +30 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [Finesse](/Traits.aspx?ID=179), [Fire](/Traits.aspx?ID=72), [Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103), [reach 20 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=192)), **Damage** 1d6+6 piercing plus 3d8 fire and 2d10 persistent fire **Ranged** flame jet +30 ([Fire](/Traits.aspx?ID=72), [range increment 40 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=248)), **Damage** 6d6 fire plus 2d10 persistent fire **Primal Innate Spells** DC 39 - **Cantrips (8th)** [Light](/Spells.aspx?ID=171) - **6th** [Restoration](/Spells.aspx?ID=258) (x3) - **7th** [Dispel Magic](/Spells.aspx?ID=78) (at will) - **8th** [Continual Flame](/Spells.aspx?ID=50) (at will), [Dispel Magic](/Spells.aspx?ID=78) (x3), [Flame Strike](/Spells.aspx?ID=120), [Heal](/Spells.aspx?ID=148) (x3), [Remove Curse](/Spells.aspx?ID=250), [Wall of Fire](/Spells.aspx?ID=362) (x3) - **Constant (6th)** [See Invisibility](/Spells.aspx?ID=271) - **Constant (8th)** [Detect Magic](/Spells.aspx?ID=66) **Flaming Strafe** ([Evocation](/Traits.aspx?ID=65), [Fire](/Traits.aspx?ID=72), [Primal](/Traits.aspx?ID=134)) The phoenix blazes with superheated flame and Flies up to its Speed. It deals 6d6 fire damage to each creature within 20 feet of each square it moves through (DC 37 basic Reflex save).
Servants of Sarenrae While phoenixes are not denizens of the Outer Planes, they have long been associated with the goddess Sarenrae. Indeed, many phoenixes view the Dawnflower as their patron and subscribe to her mission of redeeming those who have fallen to evil.
